metadata.title: CVE-2022-40304 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libxml2 before 2.10.3. Certain invalid XML entity definitions can corrupt a hash table key, potentially leading to subsequent logic errors. In one case, a double-free can be provoked.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.14+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.14+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
python3-libxml2 - 2.9.14+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

advisory.discovered_by: Ned Williamson and Nathan Wachholz from Google Project Zero

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.14+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
